div.p: J73/7112, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. Botanic Garden

In accordance with your kind promise already orally given, I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of the sum of £110 from the vote for "Purchase of Plants and Publication of Works" to the vote for "Stores, Forage etc. also the transfer of the sum of £120 voted for a Test plantation in the Ranges and of £74.10/—, surplus of vote for "Reward to orphanboys employed in the Garden," making in the aggregate £194.10/— to the vote for "Wages", in order to enable me to meet the necessary expenditure during the current financial year. The vote for Transit and Incidental Expenses will also be insufficient, especially in consequence of the unexpected charge for packing of Ferntrees for Holland. I have therefore the honor to solicit that you will also grant a transfer of the sum of £30 to this vote from the vote for "Purchase of Plants & Publication of Works."

div.p:
The Honorable the Commissioner of Lands & Survey
Casey approved M's requests on 24 April 1873. The transfers were completed and M was duly informed on 19 May. On 21 May M 'Returned with best thanks to Mr Agg' the relevant file.
